questions.guidance: Enter a first name.

questions.guidance: Enter a last name.

questions.question: Organization
questions.guidance: Enter the organization name.

questions.question: First name
questions.guidance: Enter a first name.

questions.question: Last name
questions.guidance: Enter a last name.

questions.question: Organization
questions.guidance: Enter the organization name.

questions.question: Project Role
questions.guidance: Select or type a short description of the contact's relationship to the project.

store: Person or agency that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource.
Agency providing all or some of the funding for this project.
Person or agency that prepares and maintains the metadata record for this project.
Person or agency other than the Principle Investigator or Funding Recipient that makes significant intellectual contribution to the project.
Person or Agency serving as a metadata clearinghouse for this project record.
Person or agency that is responsible for the project finances.
Person or agency to contact for acquiring knowledge about this project.
Key person or agency responsible for gathering information and conducting research.
Person or agency that provides access to project data resources.
Person or agency that is a collaborator and funder(makes both financial and intellectual contributions).
Entity receiving funding for a project, responsible for satisfying agreement terms and conditions. Automatically assumes the role of Collaborator.
Primary staff member overseeing the project, usually identified in contracting documents.
Point of contact for grant administration at recipient institution.

questions.question: Name
questions.guidance: Enter Name of Existing Collection.

questions.question: Description
questions.guidance: Describe the information that will be used, including its characteristics, temporal scope and scale, and geographic scope and scale, when available.

questions.question: Source
questions.guidance: Identify the source for the data; include a link and digital object identifier (DOI) if available.

questions.question: Restrictions
questions.guidance: Identify any limitations on access or reuse (e.g., sensitive data, restricted data, software with license restrictions, etc.) and provide justification for restriction. Provide citation or documentation describing limitations if due to policies or legal reasons.

questions.question: Format
questions.guidance: Identify the formats in which the data are maintained and made available.

questions.question: Fees
questions.guidance: Identify any fees associated with acquiring the data.

questions.question: Quality Checks
questions.guidance: Identify the procedural steps used to evaluate the existing data, including verification, validation, and an assessment of usability.

questions.question: Data Processing & Scientific Workflows
questions.guidance: Describe any data processing steps or provide a scientific workflow you plan to use to manipulate the data, as appropriate.

questions.question: Backup & Storage
questions.guidance: Describe the approach for backup and storage of the information associated with the research project during the project.

questions.question: Volume Estimate
questions.guidance: Estimate the volume of information that will be generated megabyte (MB), GB, TB, or PB.

questions.question: Citation
questions.guidance: Provide citation for data product. If the data product can be found online, provide a URL.

questions.question: Name
questions.guidance: Provide a brief name to describe new data collection.

questions.question: Description
questions.guidance: Describe the information that will be collected, including its characteristics, temporal scope and scale, and geographic scope and scale, when available.

questions.question: Data Management Resources
questions.guidance: Describe the proposal resources allocated for data management activities for the new data collected as a level of effort, total dollars allocated, or as a percentage of the total project’s cost. Resources could include people’s time or proposal funding.

questions.question: Exclusive Use
questions.guidance: Project data and associated products should be available publicly at the end of the project. If a request to limit access for a period of time after project completion is needed, please identify the length of time and the reason for the extension. (Request cannot be more than one year.)

questions.question: Restrictions
questions.guidance: Identify any limitations on access or reuse (e.g., sensitive data, restricted data, software with license restrictions, etc.) and provide justification for restriction. Provide citation or documentation describing limitations if due to policies or legal reasons.

questions.question: Format
questions.guidance: Identify the formats in which the data will be generated, maintained, and made available.

questions.question: Protocols
questions.guidance: Identify any standard protocols or methodologies that will be used to collect the data, if available.

questions.question: Quality Checks
questions.guidance: Identify the procedural steps for ensuring data quality.

questions.question: Data Processing & Scientific Workflows
questions.guidance: Describe data processing steps or provide a scientific workflow you plan to use to manipulate the data, as appropriate.

questions.question: Metadata
questions.guidance: Identify the metadata standard that will be used to describe the document (FGDC, ISO, EML, etc.)

questions.question: Volume Estimate
questions.guidance: Estimate the volume of information generated: megabyte (MB), GB, TB, or PB.

questions.question: Backup & Storage
questions.guidance: Describe the approach for backup and storage of the information associated with the research project during the project.

questions.question: Repository for Data
questions.guidance: Identify any repositories where you plan to share your data. Indicate if data will be integrated into an existing collection or offered as a new collection.

questions.question: Citation
questions.guidance: Specify how the project’s data should be cited.

questions.question: Digital Object Identifier (DOI)/Link
questions.guidance: Provide a digital object identifier (DOI)/link to the data when available publicly. The DOI should be in the form of a URL, e.g. http://dx.doi.org/10.1000/182

questions.question: Lifespan of Data
questions.guidance: At some point, datasets may be archived. Choose one of the following options to indicate how long you anticipate this data will be of value to other researchers. Less than 5 years, 5-10 years, 10-20 years, 20-50 years, 50+ years.

questions.question: Name
questions.guidance: Name of Model

questions.question: Description
questions.guidance: Provide a brief description of the model and its purpose

questions.question: Model Version
questions.guidance: Identify the version of model used

questions.question: Link
questions.guidance: Provide a link or a source for the model

questions.question: Model Input(s)
questions.guidance: Enter the types of input data required for driving, calibrating, or validating the model. For proposals, summary information is all that is needed. For funded projects, these should be described in detail in the existing or new collection, data inputs section

questions.question: Model Output(s)
questions.guidance: Enter the types of output data the model will produce. For proposals, summary information is all that is needed. For funded projects, provide more details as known. If the model output is a generated dataset that is a project deliverable, describe it in detail in the data product section

questions.question: Calibration Details
questions.guidance: Briefly describe the calibration/validation approach being taken

questions.question: Name
questions.guidance: Name of Software or Other Tool

questions.question: Description
questions.guidance: Describe the custom software, code, or web tool developed or used as part of the project

questions.question: Software/Tool Version
questions.guidance: Identify the version of used

questions.question: Link
questions.guidance: If the custom software or code can be accessed via an online repository, provide a link

questions.question: Restrictions
questions.guidance: Identify any limitations on access or reuse

questions.question: Maintenance and Support
questions.guidance: If a tool is developed as part of the project, is there a strategy for the ongoing support and maintenance of the tool after the project is complete? If so, briefly describe it

questions.question: Languages
questions.guidance: Identify the computing language/framework that was used (e.g., Java, .Net, Ruby, Rails, SQL, etc.

questions.question: Environment
questions.guidance: Identify the operating system environment (e.g., Windows, Linux, MacOS X, etc.

questions.guidance: Describe the information that will be produced, including its characteristics, temporal scope and scale, and geographic scope and scale, when available

questions.question: Data Management Resources
questions.guidance: Describe the proposal resources allocated for data management activities for the data products as a level of effort, total dollars allocated, or as a percentage of the total project’s cost. Resources could include people’s time or proposal funding
